Topics: Applications of Derivatives (Tangents, Normals, Increasing/Decreasing Functions, Maxima and Minima)
Applications of Integration (Area under Curves, Volume of Solids of Revolution)
Sequences and Series (Convergence Tests, Power Series)
Basic Applications of Derivatives and Integrals to Real-Life Problems
Properties of Triangles (Sine Rule, Cosine Rule, Area Formulas)
Circle, Parabola, Ellipse, and Hyperbola (Conic Sections)
Events: Types of Events (Simple, Compound, Mutually Exclusive, Exhaustive)
Measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode for grouped and ungrouped data)
Measures of dispersion (range, mean deviation, variance, standard deviation)
Correlation (Karl Pearson’s method, Spearman’s rank correlation)
Linear regression (line of best fit using the least squares method)
Probability distribution of a random variable (basic level)
Use of statistical tables (mean, standard deviation, z-scores)
Application-based word problems using real data sets
Homomorphisms and Isomorphisms in Algebraic Structures
Solving Systems of Linear Equations (Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors)
Applications of Algebra in Cryptography and Coding Theory (Introductory)
Multivariable Calculus (Partial Derivatives, Gradient, Divergence, Curl)
Vector Calculus (Line Integrals, Surface Integrals, Green’s, Stokes’, and Divergence Theorems)
Sequences and Series (Taylor, Maclaurin Series, Fourier Series)
Ordinary Differential Equations (Higher Order, Systems of ODEs)
Differential Forms and Integration on Manifolds (Introductory)
Line and Surface Integrals in Geometry
Geometric Interpretations in Linear Algebra (e.g., Inner Product Spaces)
Probability mass function (PMF) and probability density function (PDF)
Law of large numbers (weak and strong forms)
Common distributions: binomial, Poisson, geometric, hypergeometric, uniform, normal, exponential, gamma, beta
Descriptive statistics (measures of central tendency and dispersion)
Properties of estimators (unbiasedness, consistency, efficiency, sufficiency)
Method of moments and maximum likelihood estimation (MLE)
Hypothesis testing (Z, t, chi-square, and F tests)
Tests of significance (single and two-sample tests for mean, variance, proportion)
Analysis of variance (ANOVA) – one-way and two-way
Non-parametric tests (Sign test, Wilcoxon, Kruskal-Wallis, Mann-Whitney U test)
Time series analysis (trend, seasonal variations, cyclic variations)
Statistical quality control (control charts for variables and attributes)
